Name: Introduction to Programming
Description: Learn the fundamentals of programming using a high-level language. Topics include variables, loops, and functions.

Name: Calculus I
Description: An introduction to differential and integral calculus, focusing on limits, derivatives, and integrals.

Name: English Literature
Description: A survey of English literature, including major works from different literary periods.

Name: Introduction to Biology
Description: An introductory course on the basics of biology, including cell structure, genetics, and evolution.

Name: General Chemistry
Description: Study of chemical principles including atomic structure, bonding, and stoichiometry.

Name: Physics I
Description: Basic concepts of mechanics, energy, and motion, with applications to real-world problems.

Name: Data Structures
Description: Introduction to common data structures such as arrays, stacks, queues, and linked lists.

Name: Calculus II
Description: Continuation of Calculus I, focusing on techniques of integration, series, and multivariable calculus.

Name: Shakespearean Drama
Description: In-depth study of the works of William Shakespeare, analyzing major plays and their themes.

Name: Human Anatomy
Description: Study of the human body, including the skeletal, muscular, circulatory, and nervous systems.

Name: Organic Chemistry
Description: Introduction to the structure, properties, and reactions of organic compounds and materials.

Name: Electromagnetism
Description: Study of electric fields, magnetic fields, and electromagnetic waves, including their interactions with matter.

Name: Algorithms
Description: Study of algorithms, including sorting, searching, and optimization techniques.

Name: Linear Algebra
Description: Introduction to matrices, vector spaces, and linear transformations.

Name: Modern World Literature
Description: Exploration of modern literature, focusing on authors from the 20th and 21st centuries.

Name: Genetics
Description: Study of inheritance, gene expression, and molecular biology.

Name: Physical Chemistry
Description: Study of the principles of thermodynamics, kinetics, and quantum chemistry.

Name: Quantum Mechanics
Description: Introduction to the principles of quantum theory, including wave functions and quantum states.

Name: Operating Systems
Description: Study of the fundamental concepts of operating systems, including processes, memory management, and file systems.

Name: Probability and Statistics
Description: Introduction to probability theory, random variables, distributions, and statistical inference.

Name: Rhetoric and Composition
Description: Focus on writing skills and effective argumentation in various forms of discourse.

Name: Ecology
Description: Study of ecosystems, environmental factors, and the interactions between organisms and their environments.

Name: Biochemistry
Description: Introduction to the chemical processes within living organisms, including metabolism and enzyme function.

Name: Astrophysics
Description: Study of the physical properties of celestial bodies, including stars, planets, and galaxies.

Name: Software Engineering
Description: Introduction to software development, including the software development lifecycle, methodologies, and design patterns.

Name: Discrete Mathematics
Description: Study of mathematical structures that are fundamentally discrete rather than continuous, such as graphs and combinatorics.
